title: datalad save -d^ still goes into unrelated to current invocation subds of the super
body:
unfortunately could not reproduce locally with a minimal example yet :-/  but what I am observing is that calling `datalad save -d^ -m msg` in `subds1/subds` seems cause assessment of status in other (than my subds1 here) sub datasets (and their subdatasets) from the top level of the super dataset. 

```shell
.../$ datalad status
 modified: analyses (dataset)

.../$ datalad --version
datalad 0.12.0rc4.dev71
```

```shell
.../$ cd analyses/1st-level/                                             

.../analyses/1st-level$ datalad -l debug save -d^ -m "Adding .fsf files 
which were previously not generated due to missing ev3 files"  2>&1 | grep BIOS                               
[DEBUG] <GitRepo path=.../BIOS (<class 'datalad.support.gitrepo.GitRepo'>)>.get_content_info(...)
                                                                                                              
[DEBUG] Done <GitRepo path=.../BIOS (<class 'datalad.support.gitrepo.GitRepo'>)>.get_content_info
(...)                                                                                                         
...
[DEBUG] <GitRepo path=.../BIOS/bids (<class 'datalad.support.gitrepo.GitRepo'>)>.get_content_info
(...)                                       
... 
```
for which IMHO there is no need.   There is no log message which could inform **why** preceding the first traversal into unrelated subdatasets of the super (would be nice to have).
@mih - any idea on what to check for?
